commands.name: run-ios
commands.description: builds your app and starts it on iOS simulator

examples.desc: Run on a different simulator, e.g. iPhone SE (2nd generation)
Run on a connected device, e.g. Max's iPhone

options.name: --simulator <string>
options.description: Explicitly set simulator to use. Optionally include iOS version between parenthesis at the end to match an exact version: "iPhone 6 (10.0)"

options.name: --configuration <string>
options.description: Explicitly set the scheme configuration to use

options.name: --scheme <string>
options.description: Explicitly set Xcode scheme to use

options.name: --device [string]
options.description: Explicitly set device to use by name.  The value is not required if you have a single device connected.

options.name: --udid <string>
options.description: Explicitly set device to use by udid

options.name: --no-packager
options.description: Do not launch packager while building

options.name: --verbose
options.description: Do not use xcbeautify or xcpretty even if installed

options.name: --terminal <string>
options.description: Launches the Metro Bundler in a new window using the specified terminal path.

commands.name: run-android
commands.description: builds your app and starts it on a connected Android emulator or device

options.name: --appId <string>
options.description: Specify an applicationId to launch after build. If not specified, `package` from AndroidManifest.xml will be used.

options.name: --appIdSuffix <string>
options.description: Specify an applicationIdSuffix to launch after build.

options.name: --main-activity <string>
options.description: Name of the activity to start

options.name: --deviceId <string>
options.description: builds your app and starts it on a specific device/simulator with the given device id (listed by running "adb devices" on the command line).

options.name: --no-packager
options.description: Do not launch packager while building

options.name: --terminal <string>
options.description: Launches the Metro Bundler in a new window using the specified terminal path.

options.name: --tasks <list>
options.description: Run custom Gradle tasks. By default it's "installDebug"

options.name: --active-arch-only
options.description: Build native libraries only for the current device architecture for debug builds.
